CircusOfPlates
Class PlateBar

java.lang.Object
  CircusOfPlates.PlateBar
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
public class PlateBar
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable

Since:
JDK 1.6
Version:
1.0
Author:
Mostafa Mahmod Mahmod Eweda A plate bar is designed to handle the motion of the plates on the bars before falling area in the sky Should be managed by continuous update function calls from the GUI view
See Also:
QueueImpl, Plate, Serialized Form

Field Summary
(package private)  double angle
          the angle with which the fallen plate has rotated
(package private) static double ANGLE
          The angle with which the on edge plate should rotate each update
private static int BAR_RATE
          The number of updates the bar should be still before changing its length randomly

          The colors of the bar levels

          The default width of the plate bars

          true if the bar is left to right bar; false otherwise

          The line shape that represents the bar
private static int MAX_BARS
          The maximum number of bars supported by the game
private static org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color[] plateColors
          The colors of the plates that are generated randomly
private  QueueImpl queue
          queue of plates to hold the plates currently on the bar
private  java.util.Random rand
          The random that generates the motion of the bar and the creation of plates
private  int shift
          The shift of the last plate from the end of the display area
private  int shifted
          The previous number of pixels shifted to the plate
private  org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Point start
          The start point of the bar
private  int updates
          number of updates done after last change
private static int updateStep
          The updates step with which the plates hould be updated

PlateBar

public PlateBar(int startX,
                int endX,
                int heightIdent,
                int level,
                boolean leftToRight)
creates a plate bar with the given location and length

Parameters:
startX - the startX in which the bar should start from
endX - the end of the bar
heightIdent - the height indentation from the display bounds
level - the level of the plate bar
leftToRight - true of left to right bar motion; false otherwise
